intro: Lactuca ludoviciana, commonly known as prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and a distinctive, spiny stem. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
